description:
Actinidia eriantha is a species of woody vine belonging to the Actinidiaceae family. It is native to central and eastern Asia, particularly found in regions of China, Japan, and Korea.

The plant is a deciduous climber, capable of reaching up to 15 meters in length. Its stems are covered in short, bristly hairs. The leaves are large, ovate to oblong in shape, and measure between 10-20 cm in length. They have a distinctive hairy texture on both the upper and lower surfaces.

Actinidia eriantha produces white or pale green flowers that are approximately 2-3 cm in diameter. These flowers typically appear in clusters during the spring and early summer months. The fruit is an edible berry, oval-shaped, and ranges in color from yellow to brown when fully ripe.

This species is valued for its potential use in ornamental horticulture and as a source of edible fruit. It can tolerate a range of soil conditions and climates, making it a hardy and adaptable vine species within its native geographic range.
